abstract: Stockbroker Vladimir Eydelman pleads guilty to conspiracy to commit securities and tender offer fraud for his role in five-year insider trading scheme; faces up to 25 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: A stockbroker has admitted to his role in a five-year insider trading scheme that yielded more than $5.6 million in net profits.

headline.main: Stockbroker Pleads Guilty in Insider Trading Case
headline.print_headline: Stockbroker Pleads Guilty in Insider Trading Case

snippet: A stockbroker has admitted to his role in a five-year insider trading scheme that yielded more than $5.6 million in net profits.
